story:
Once upon a time, in a land filled with warm sand and clear blue skies, there was a magical city called Baghdad. This city was known far and wide for its beautiful gardens, bustling markets, and wise scholars.

In this enchanting city lived a kind and gentle girl named Noor. Noor was known for her love of animals, especially her beloved horse, Bilaal. Every day, Noor would take Bilaal out for a ride along the Tigris River, and the two would watch as the sun set behind the ancient walls of the city.

One day, as Noor and Bilaal were enjoying their ride, they stumbled upon a mysterious cave hidden behind a thicket of palm trees. Curiosity piqued, Noor decided to explore the cave and see what secrets it held.

As they entered the cave, Noor and Bilaal found themselves surrounded by shimmering walls of gold and jewels. In the center of the cave, there sat a wise old man with a long white beard and twinkling eyes.

The old man greeted Noor and asked her why she had come to the cave. Noor explained that she was simply exploring and had never seen anything like this before.

The old man smiled and said, "I have been waiting for someone pure of heart and filled with kindness to find this cave. You see, I am a powerful magician, and I have the ability to grant you one wish."

Noor was overjoyed at the prospect of making a wish. She thought long and hard about what she wanted most in the world and finally said, "I wish for peace and happiness for all the people of Baghdad, and for all the animals in the land."

The magician was touched by Noor's selflessness and granted her wish. From that day on, Baghdad was known as the city of peace and happiness, where all the people and animals lived together in harmony.

Noor and Bilaal continued to explore the cave, discovering more treasures and wisdom beyond their wildest dreams. And every night, as Noor lay in bed, she knew that her wish had come true, and that the people and animals of Baghdad were living happily ever after.

And with that, my darling daughter, it is time for you to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, knowing that the world is filled with kindness and love. Goodnight.
